sentence.Network_en: Right below the entrenchment, you will find another underground bunker.
sentence.Network_cn: 在堑壕的下方, 你能找到另一个地下碉堡.

sentence.Network_en: There has been a shift in opinion on the issue after a decade of entrenchment.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那议题上十年的固守之后,有了转变的看法.

entry.def: Entrenchments are a series of long deep holes called trenches which are dug for defence by soldiers in war.
Entrenchment means the firm establishment of a system or your own position in a situation.

means.word_mean: 1. an entrenched fortification; a position protected by trenches

auth_sentence.content: It could even force entrenchment - change some politics in a dangerous way, said Senator Kerry.
